If at some time \\( t_1 \\), another transformation \\( k(x) = Nx \\) is applied as an intervention, will the final state \\( x(T) \\) at T > t_1 depend solely on the matrix D and not on M or N?
Explanation: The additional intervention at time \\( t_1 \\) with \\( k(x) = Nx \\) introduces a new transformation affecting the trajectory of our vector field, making the final state \\( x(T) \\) dependent also on matrices M and N, alongside D. The transformations due to \\( M \\) and \\( N \\) can distinctly alter the vector field pathway leading up to T, depending on their relationship with D.
